rules.description: Cantus and counterpoint must have the same number of notes.
First species uses only whole notes.
The lower voice should never meet or cross above the upper voice.
Every vertical interval must be consonant.
Beginning and ending intervals must be perfect consonances.
Avoid parallel fifths and octaves between adjacent notes.
The cantus firmus should not repeat the note played immediately before.
The counterpoint line may have no more than one repeated tone.
A voice's highest note should only appear once.
The cantus firmus should end with scale degree 2 descending to scale degree 1.
The counterpoint line should end with scale degree 7 ascending to scale degree 1.
